questions: In what ways were the novels in colonial India useful for both the colonizers as well as the nationalists ?
answers: Colonial administrators found vernacular novels a valuable source of information about native life and customs. Indians used novels as a medium to criticise the defects in their society and suggest remedies.  Through glorified account of the past, these novels helped in creating a sene of national pride among their readers.

questions: Explain the contribution of Premchand in the field of novel writing.
answers: Premchand’s novels are filled with all kinds of powerful characters drawn from all levels of society.  His novels include characters such as aristocrats and landlords, middle level peasants and landless labourers, etc. The women characters are strong individuals.  Drawn from various strata of society, his characters create a community based on democratic values. The central character of his novel ‘Rangbhoomi’, Surdas is a visually impaired beggar from a socalled ‘untouchable’ caste.  Godan, Premchand’s best known work is an epic of Indian peasantry.

questions: How does ‘Saraswativijayam’ lays stress upon the importance of education for the upliftment of the lower castes ?

questions: How was the problem of being modern without losing one’s identity was solved by the main character of Indulekha ?
answers: The author of Malayalam novel Indulekha portrayed his protagonists Indulekha and Madhavan as English educated, smart, intelligent young people who had good knowledge of Sanskrit too.  The hero of the novel completed his education from the university of Madras in English. He used to dress in western clothing and also sported a lift of hair as per the customers of his Nayar community. These characters portrayed many aspects of traditional upbringing and modern education to strike the right balance.  The characters had the fear of losing their identity due to English education. So they used to held onto their cultural tradition in various forms.
